Full_Address: 7806 Yucca Drive, New Port Richey, FL 34653, USA

Name: Nicolas Foster
Shots_Fired: Foster stabbed his wife and friend. Police then entered the conflict and would refuse to drop his weapon, resulting in him getting shot and killed by officers.

Name: Valeri Hawkins
Shots_Fired: A suicidal woman pointed a gun at officers. Officers then shot and killed her.

Name: unknown
Shots_Fired: Second of two unidentified robbery suspects who rammed the police car and others trying to escape.

Name: Eddie Fernandez
Shots_Fired: Unlicensed and without helmets, Fernandez and a friend were riding a dirt bike in tandem down city streets when they attracted police attention. Fernandez sustained a mortal head wound in the wreck that followed and the friend was injured. Contrary to initial police reports, surveillance video showed that police had violently collided with the bike and caused the accident.
Full_Address: Randall Avenue & Coster Street, Bronx, NY 10474, USA

Name: Thomas N. Saunders
Shots_Fired: Saunders pointed a gun at an officer, prompting the officer to shoot and kill Saunders.

Name: David James Barclay
Shots_Fired: Barclay was estranged from his wife and their 3-year-old son. He barged his way into her house with a handgun. A visiting friend escaped and called 911. When police arrived, with a full SWAT team, Barclay refused to drop his weapon and instead shot at them. Police returned fire, killing Barclay.
Full_Address: 6500 North Clayton Avenue, Dunnellon, FL 34434, USA

Name: Juan Calves
Shots_Fired: Calves and another man were caught riding between subway cars. Detained on the platform, Calves managed to get a female officer in a headlock, stole her weapon, and fired it five times. Two other officers shot him to death. The female officer was also wounded by gunfire.

Name: Guyatree (or "Guiatree") Harpati
Shots_Fired: Harpati was shot to death by her boyfriend, a serving NYPD transit cop, after an attempted reconciliation at a restaurant. The officer first tried to claim she was accidentally shot during an abortive street robbery. He was given 25 to life for manslaughter.
Full_Address: Atlantic Avenue & 82nd Street, Queens, NY 11421, USA

Name: Osbourne Broadie
Shots_Fired: Broadie stabbed his girlfriend with scissors. Officers told Broadie to drop the scissors, but he lunged at the officers instead. Officers then shot and killed Broadie.

Name: George D’Amato Jr.
Shots_Fired: Police responded to a "man with a gun" call to discover D'Amato on a schoolyard playground waving a toy gun. He'd pointed it at two adults; no children were around. D'Amato leveled the toy at officers as soon as they arrived. He was duly shot to death.

Name: Kevin White
Shots_Fired: White was a security guard in a nightclub and was shot by NYPD in a 3 a.m. melee as he levelled a weapon towards them. Officers also wounded another man at the scene. With the police in plainsclothes and in chaotic loud conditions, questions arose about how they could have identified themselves.

Name: Arcenio Lujan
Shots_Fired: Police came to Lujan's home because he was reported suicidal. They spoke to him for a half-hour before he leveled the rifle at them and began advancing.
Full_Address: Castle Drive, Las Vegas, NM 87701, USA

Name: Philip E. Rank
Shots_Fired: Officers attempted to serve a warrant, but Rank barricaded himself in the house. When he came out holding a weapon he was sho

Name: Darius Williams
Shots_Fired: Officers patrolling an area known for drug activity and gang violence were talking to a person they stopped when they heard sounds from a nearby house. They went inside and saw Darius Williams, 20, "who pointed a gun at the officer. ... The officer then fired his own weapon, hitting the suspect in the arm," according to reports.

Name: Charles Jameson
Shots_Fired: Jameson was wearing a mask and intruded in a acquaintance's home. Deputies arrived and shot and killed Jameson after a short fight.

Name: Ricky Lee Higgins
Shots_Fired: Higgins was released from prison in Dec. 2013 after a 12-year stint. Police came to arrest him at his trailer for violating parole six months later. Higgins, who was armed, escaped through a secret hatch but encountered two officers in the woods. He fired two shots at the officers and they returned fire, killing him. Higgins had often stated he would die in a police shootout before going back to prison.
Full_Address: Southwest 1200th Road & 1521st Road, Holden, MO 64040, USA

Name: Michael Nehez
Shots_Fired: SWAT officers called to the scene by Nehez himself found him with a knife actively threatening them. He and his wife were going through a painful divorce with prior police complaints. Officers shot Nehez to death and found his wife inside strangled to death.
Full_Address: 678 San Pedro Avenue, Sunnyvale, CA 94085, USA

Name: Corsini Valdes
Shots_Fired: Adrian Montesano's attempted robbery of a Walgreen's turned into a multi-hour manhunt with numerous officers injured before ending in a fatal shootout. Montesano and Corsini Valdes, Valdes blameless and both unarmed, were hit dozens of times as around 23 police officers fired hundreds of rounds into the car.
Full_Address: Northwest 27th Avenue & Northwest 65th Street, Miami, FL 33147, USA

Name: Aaron Nathaniel McCoy
Shots_Fired: McCoy and another man in a stolen Accord, both suspects in a string of local burglaries, were chased by police at high speed down rural Maryland roads. The men struck two other vehicles. McCoy died of his injuries, the other suspect went to jail, and the other vehicles' occupants suffered minor injuries.
Full_Address: Dulaney Valley Road & Ivy Church Road, Lutherville-Timonium, MD 21093, USA

Name: Rodney Hodge
Shots_Fired: Unresponsive to police attempts at conversation, Hodge had been walking in the neighborhood with a gun, shooting it, pointing it at others. He'd had frequent although relatively minor prior contacts with police. When he moved towards officers he was fatally shot.

Name: Tommy Yancy Jr.
Shots_Fired: An Army veteran of both Iraq and Afghanistan, Yancy was the subject of a traffic stop, reportedly for a missing front license plate. He was pulled from his vehicle, Tased, attacked by a police dog, then beaten to death on the roadside as documented on a private video.
Full_Address: North Imperial Avenue & East 15th Street, Imperial, CA 92251, USA

Name: Darren Faulkner
Shots_Fired: Unarmed Faulkner was pepper-sprayed and Tased for being uncooperative as county officers attempted to break up a late-afternoon fight on the lawn of a rural residence in the southeastern part of the county. Eventually 8 to 10 officers were involved in trying to subdue Faulkner, who was apparently Tased after he was cuffed and down. He died shortly afterward.
Full_Address: Red Banks Road South, Byhalia, MS 38611, USA

Name: Ashley DiPiazza
Shots_Fired: DiPiazza was shot and killed by officers after she refused to comply with the officer's orders to drop the gun.

Name: Howard Carvel Smith
Shots_Fired: unknown

Name: Juan Antonio Solis-Diaz
Shots_Fired: Police were called to investigate am unknown disturbance in a neighborhood.  Upon arrival they heard screaming and took cover behind an SUV.  Solis-Diaz opened the garage door of his home and began shooting at officers with an assault rifle

Name: Hwan Yu
Shots_Fired: Hwan Yu and Han Lee were sought as suspects in a violent home-invasion. Tracked to their second-floor apartment through a victim who recognized their car, officers first knocked then kicked the door down. Yu and Lee put up armed resistance, wounding two officers. The suspects were shot to death.
Full_Address: 2900 West Summerdale Avenue, Chicago, IL 60625, USA

Name: Han Lee
Shots_Fired: Hwan Yu and Han Lee were sought as suspects in a violent home-invasion. Tracked to their second-floor apartment through a victim who recognized their car, officers first knocked then kicked the door down. Yu and Lee put up armed resistance, wounding two officers. The suspects were shot to death.
Full_Address: 2900 West Summerdale Avenue, Chicago, IL 60625, USA

Name: Deborah A. McCollum
Shots_Fired: McCollum called 911 call, requesting assistance because she was going to commit suicide. When police arrived on the scene, deputies saw McCollum with a handgun at the front door of her home. One the deputies shot McCollum. Emergency responders pronounced her dead at the scene.

Name: Brian Scott Hiatt
Shots_Fired: Hiatt killed two women, when deputies arrived, they shot and killed Hiatt after he was aggressive towards deputies.

Name: Frank McQueen
Shots_Fired: McQueen shot at an officer. McQueen was ultimately shot and killed.

Name: Timothy Ronald Lloyd
Shots_Fired: Lloyd charged at an officer. The officer then shot and killed Lloyd.

Name: Kristopher Simmons
Shots_Fired: Simmons was barricaded in his car. After hours of negotiations he pointed his gun at officers and SWAT shot and killed him.

Name: Harold Murphy
Shots_Fired: Murphy was pursued by officers over a warrant. Murphy ran and was tackled by an officer. Murphy pulled out a gun and was subsequently shot and killed by officers.
Full_Address: 614 Sheridan Lake Road, Rapid City, SD 57702, USA

Name: Glen Griggs
Shots_Fired: Griggs was a homicide suspect. When police approached him he had a BB gun. Officers demanded him to drop his weapon, he did not comply resulting in officers shooting and killing Griggs.
Full_Address: 499 North Fair Oaks Avenue, Sunnyvale, CA 94085, USA

Name: Steven Jerold Thompson
Shots_Fired: Thompson

Name: Kenneth Shawn Todd
Shots_Fired: Todd approached deputy Winders with a weapon and would not respond to orders to stop, resulting in Winders shooting and killing Todd.
Full_Address: NC Noname Eight-Hundred Forty, Macclesfield, NC 27852, USA

Name: Corey Brown
Shots_Fired: Late evening on Easter three local officers responded to a domestic disturbance call to find Brown, unarmed but aggressive and agitated, on the sidewalk. He made a hand motion that officers interpreted as threatening, and was shot to death.

Name: Jose Walter Garza
Shots_Fired: Garza pulled a pellet gun, a replica of a semiautomatic weapon, on officers at a truck stop at 2 a.m. Six officers killed him with over 80 rounds. Garza had a history of schizophrenia. His grandmother was forced to change burial plans because the 80 shots had essentially removed his face.
Full_Address: 5301 Santa Maria Avenue, Laredo, TX 78041, USA

Name: Ricky Gatewood
Shots_Fired: Gatewood was one of three people in a vehicle stopped by local police. Wanted on a probation violation, Gatewood emerged from the car shooting. In the resulting firefight Gatewood was killed and the other occupants were seriously wounded.
Full_Address: Metropolitan Avenue & South 34th Street, Kansas City, KS 66106, USA

Name: Jesse France
Shots_Fired: France was an ex-con who had failed to check in with his community corrections officer, and had been considered a suspect in recent felony cases. When a multi-jurisdictional task force came for him, unarmed France struck another vehicle in an escape attempt, then "the situation was escalated by Mr. France" according to officers, and he was shot dead.

Name: Javon Rakestrau
Shots_Fired: While attempting to arrest Rakestrau on drug charges, parish officers Tased him, and he died shortly afterward. The pathologist report attributed the death to bronchial asthma. In July 2013 his family settled a wrongful death suit with the parish for an undisclosed amount.

Name: Reginald Wylie Osby
Shots_Fired: Osby's mentally-ill 27-year-old stepson had come to his house and attacked him, his wife and other family members with a knife. Police arrived and fatally shot Osby, claiming Osby was assaulting the stepson with a barbecue fork. Family members held that the two men weren't even in the same room. The stepson was charged with attempted murder.

Name: Steven Thompson
Shots_Fired: Police received 911 call that two women had been robbed at gunpoint by two men. During canvass of area, they found Thompson, who was armed and fled into a nearby apartment complex. Police followed him, and when Thompson shot at them in a hallway, they returned fire, fatally wounding the suspect. Thompson's alleged accomplice was later apprehended.

Name: Paul Alan L'Herault
Shots_Fired: Unknown man was a veteran diagnosed with PTSD. He called his VA psychiatrist to report he was suicidal and mixing alcohol with his meds. Psychiatrist called police and asked for a welfare check. Police found man in his driveway holding a rifle. When the man allegedly pointed the rifle in their direction, an officer shot and killed the man. (suggest calling Aurora PD for man's name, it is not in media reports).
Full_Address: 3300 South Nucla Way, Aurora, CO 80013, USA

Name: Tim Mulqueen
Shots_Fired: Mulqueen, said to have a history of schizophrenia and off his medication, arrived and circled the Middletown City Court building several times on a dirt bike before hopping off, grabbing a shotgun, and running up the steps. Once inside he shot and wounded one of two court officers. He was fatally shot.

Name: Larry Smith
Shots_Fired: Smith aimed a gun at troopers - they responded by shooting and killing Smith

Name: Vincent James Lumia III
Shots_Fired: Three county officers and a state trooper found Lumia behind the wheel of his vehicle, having rammed the house of his stepfather. The stepfather informed the police that Lumia was bipolar and off his medication. Partly cooperative, Lumia refused to unlock his door and finally rammed police vehicles with his Ford Explorer. He was fatally shot.
Full_Address: 208 Eanes Road Northeast, Check, VA 24072, USA

Name: Luqman Ameen Abdullah / Christopher Thomas
Shots_Fired: In coordinated raids FBI agents attempted to arrest Abdullah, and others belonging to his American radical Sunni Islam group, on criminal charges of dealing in stolen goods and firearms. Abdullah was intercepted at a Dearborn warehouse. He refused to surrender, fired a weapon in resistance, and was shot to death.

Name: Tony Starnes
Shots_Fired: Starnes was shot and killed by agents as they interrupted a bank robbery. Agents observed two suspects drive north from Chicago across the Wisconsin border, join with Starnes in a stolen Honda Civic with stolen plates, then return across the state line to the parking lot of a branch bank in Richmond, Illinois. While being apprehended Starnes reportedly rammed police vehicles in an escape attempt and was fatally shot.
Full_Address: 10910 North Main Street, Richmond, IL 60071, USA

Name: Curtis Good
Shots_Fired: Police were called to Good's apartment at about 1:30 a.m. to find him ranting, under the influence of cocaine, tearing out pieces of the wall with his bare hands. Good charged the single officer, who shot eight bullets at him. Six hit and fatally wounded him. Good's family members collected a $1.35M settlement.
Full_Address: Smith Street & King Street, Perth Amboy, NJ 08861, USA

Name: Wardell Johnson Jr.
Shots_Fired: Local officers were alerted to a man riding an ATV in Westchester County and on the New England Thruway at such a high rate of speed -- 80 MPH -- that it seemed suicidal to callers. Officers gave chase until the driver, Johnson, exited to a residential area and wiped out on a corner. Johnson and the officer physically grappled, with Johnson gaining the upper hand and reaching for the officer's gun. He was shot once in the chest.

Name: John A. Sordetto
Shots_Fired: Police on the lookout for a stolen cruiser around 5 a.m. on a Sunday discovered Sordetto, who fit the description. Although innocent of the car theft he resisted arrest. This resistance developed into a violent struggle between the two. Punched in the head repeatedly, the officer was only able to draw and fire on Sordetto once, killing him, before passing out on the street.

Name: Lonnie Flemming
Shots_Fired: Flemming shot an officer more than once. The officer returned multiple shots, killing Flemming.
Full_Address: Selma Avenue & South Chestnut Street, Knoxville, TN 37914, USA

Name: Kristopher Barkus
Shots_Fired: BARKUS pointed an air-powered pellet gun at an off duty officer and then at his own head. The officer then shot and killed BARKUS.

Name: Roylee Vell Dixon
Shots_Fired: After shooting his shotgun inside a neighbors house, Dixon was addressed by a deputy to drop his weapon. Dixon fired at the deputy. The deputy responded by shooting and killing Dixon.

Name: Travis Blake Utley
Shots_Fired: After a police pulled Utley over, he rammed his vehicle into officer's vehicles prompting officers to shoot and kill Utley.
Full_Address: Southeast 52nd Avenue & Southeast Harney Drive, Portland, OR 97206, USA

Name: Earl Cranston Harris
Shots_Fired: Deputies were serving an eviction notice when Harris came out with a shotgun. Deputies responded by shooting and killing Harris.

Name: Jamal Blount
Shots_Fired: Blount was intercepted by county officers at a Long Island Railroad station for acting irrationally, challenging passengers, fighting with imaginary people, etc. Once intercepted and cuffed Blount admitted to ingesting crack cocaine, then had a seizure and stopped breathing.
Full_Address: Straight Path & Long Island Avenue, Wyandanch, NY 11798, USA

Name: Andres Morales
Shots_Fired: Morales fled from police when a car he was traveling in was pulled over by police. He was shot after police caught up to him and the 27-year-old produced a handgun.
Full_Address: 4 Dewey Place, Bay Shore, NY 11706, USA

Name: Luther Edwards
Shots_Fired: On a Thursday evening local police responding to a domestic disturbance call were greeted by a woman with serious head wounds, then surprised by Edwards leaping out at them with a samurai-style long sword. Edwards was repeatedly ordered to put down the sword but did not. Other jurisdictions responded, including a state trooper, and Edwards was shot to death.

Name: Name not reported by police
Shots_Fired: An off-duty officer intervened in an argument between a man and the man's girlfriend at a gas station. The officer and man exchanged gunshots. The officer was injured and the man killed.
Full_Address: West 7 Mile Road & Pierson Street, Detroit, MI 48219, USA

Name: Jose Muniz
Shots_Fired: After being observed by NYPD taking part in a likely drug transaction, Muniz was chased and ducked into a nearby bodega. He was uncooperative when apprehended and pepper-sprayed. Muniz began choking and had trouble breathing. Police extracted a golf-ball-sized package of cocaine from his mouth that he'd swallowed to conceal. He died in the ambulance en route to the hospital.
Full_Address: Jerome Avenue & East 213th Street, Bronx, NY 10467, USA

Name: Tyjuan Hill
Shots_Fired: Hill was one of four people in a car approached by NYPD during a prostitution sting. Hill bolted; there was a brief foot chase and then a physical struggle. According to police Hill pulled a weapon and was shot to death.
Full_Address: Hamilton Avenue & West 9th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11231, USA

Name: Suhani Bhakta
Shots_Fired: A speeding local police car without lights or siren struck and killed Bhakta as she crossed the street. In June 2013 the family settled with the city for $300K, noting that the 12-year-old had been tested for drugs but the officer at fault had not been. The same officer struck and seriously injured another pedestrian in a June 2012 high speed chase.
Full_Address: 1623 South Broadway Street, Wichita, KS 67211, USA

Name: Justin Sean Tucker
Shots_Fired: Tucker stabbed his mother to death. Deputies arrived after Tucker phoned 911. Tucker stormed down the stairs with a 'dark object'. Deputies ordered him to stop, he refused and deputies shot and killed Tucker.
Full_Address: 2917 Pine Cone Circle, Clearwater, FL 33760, USA

Name: Sheila Vawter
Shots_Fired: Vawter advanced toward an officer with a knife, resulting in the officer shooting and killing her.
Full_Address: 7650 West Old Us Highway 90, San Antonio, TX 78227, USA

Name: John Terzani
Shots_Fired: A late-evening domestic dispute in which Terzani flourished a handgun developed into a five-hour manhunt, involving multiple jurisdictions and closure of several roads. After extended negotiations Terzani appeared on the threshold of his own house and pointed his gun at police. A state trooper fatally shot him.
Full_Address: Taconic State Parkway & Carpenter Road, Hopewell Junction, NY 12533, USA

Name: Alex Figueroa
Shots_Fired: Figueroa was fighting with another man on the fifth floor of an apartment building when NYPD arrived. Told repeatedly to put down the wooden bat he was holding, he did not. The police version of events had him "lunging" at officers; family and other witnesses disputed that account. He was fatally shot in the chest.

Name: Glen Griggs
Shots_Fired: Griggs had been the prime suspect in the disappearance of his live-in girlfriend a year prior. Police came to his residence to serve a warrant. Griggs barricaded himself inside, confronted officers, and when appearing out his back door refused to drop a rifle he carried. Fearing for their own safety, police shot him to death.
Full_Address: 498 North Fair Oaks Avenue, Sunnyvale, CA 94085, USA

Name: Eric van Reid
Shots_Fired: Reid had been out of prison for five months after a 19-year stretch for rape and burglary. Checking in at a parole office, he concealed a knife from his backpack and, according to reports, either threatened a parole officer with it and/or briefly took an officer as a hostage. He was shot dead.

Name: Nehemiah Lazar Dillard
Shots_Fired: Detained and taken to a hospital for acting strangely in a stranger's yard, Dillard became uncooperative. He was Tased twice, punched an officer, and was injected by medical staff with an unidentified drug. He collapsed and died shortly afterward.

Name: Peter Lee
Shots_Fired: Two off-duty NYPD stopped by a popular Irish bar after their shift ended at 2 a.m. and became involved in a violent altercation among patrons. One of them was Lee, drinking despite being underage. Lee stabbed one of the officers multiple times, seriously wounding him. The other officer killed Lee with two bullets.

Name: Joel Crom
Shots_Fired: Police came to question Crom at his apartment building about possible involvement in a bank robbery a month prior. Witnesses said officers gave Crom ample opportunity to drop his weapon, but he did not, and was fatally shot.
Full_Address: 29505 21st Avenue South, Federal Way, WA 98003, USA

Name: Jermain Rogers Gaillard
Shots_Fired: Officer alleged to have run over Gaillard after the suspect exited the passenger side of a vehicle that had stopped on the I-65 Interchange in Prichard following a high-speed case through Baldwin and Mobile Counties.

Name: Tommy McClain
Shots_Fired: From the EPD press release: Officers from the Eureka Police Department were looking for two subjects wanted on felony warrants.An officer observed two men arguing. One of the men appeared have a handgun. Fearing the argument was escalating, he summoned additional officers who then confronted the man with the gun. As officers gave commands to the man with the gun which was now visible, the subject grabbed for the gun. A Eureka Police officer fired his weapon killing him.

Name: James Harris
Shots_Fired: During a police attempt to serve an arrest warrant for trademark counterfeiting, Harris attempted to escape out the window of his fourth-story Grand Concourse apartment building. He fell to his death.

Name: Steven McUmber
Shots_Fired: A state trooper responding to a domestic dispute encountered and was shot in the shoulder by ex-con McUmber at the threshold of his house. Wounded, the trooper returned fire and fatally shot McUmber.

Name: Darryl Battle
Shots_Fired: While attempting to cash a forged $1000 check at a branch bank, Battle left an ID behind. At first during a police visit he was cooperative and willingly let them in, but as the conversation developed he became more agitated and resistant. He excused himself for a glass of water, and returned with an 11-inch knife. He was fatally shot in the chest once.

Name: Elena Cole
Shots_Fired: Cole was killed by her husband, a 19-year NYPD lieutenant, who then shot himself in the head. Their 18-year-old at the scene daughter had tried to intervene.

Name: Ronald Wood
Shots_Fired: Local police engaged with Wood while he walked alongside a highway seemingly agitated and disoriented. That officer requested help from two state troopers. Soon after police contact, Wood became irrational and combative. While being restrained he experienced some kind of fatal medical emergency, later blamed on cocaine toxicity.
Full_Address: Joslen Boulevard & Green Acres Road, Hudson, NY 12534, USA

Name: Omar J. Edwards
Shots_Fired: Edwards, an off-duty black officer of the NYPD, was fatally shot by another white NYPD officer as he chased a suspect who'd broken into his car.
Full_Address: 2nd Avenue & East 124th Street, New York, NY 10035, USA

Name: Johnathan Smith
Shots_Fired: Official reports had Smith dying during arrest because of drug ingestion. Several of the 20 to 30 witnesses reported that in fact Smith had been beaten to death by police while restrained and cuffed.

Name: Kristin Palumbo-Longo
Shots_Fired: Palumbo-Longo was stabbed to death by her husband, a Utica police detective, who then killed himself. He'd been relieved of his service weapon. The killing was ten days after she'd filed for divorce. In December 2013 their children were to collect a $2M wrongful death settlement from the city on the basis that they'd done too little to protect her.
Full_Address: 10508 Cosby Manor Road, Utica, NY 13502, USA

Name: Ronald Herrera
Shots_Fired: Two men on a dirt bike, Herrera and another man, either collided with or were rammed by an NYPD cruiser on Bronx streets. The second man was paralyzed and his family brought a major lawsuit against the city, disputing the police account.
Full_Address: Randall Avenue & Coster Street, Bronx, NY 10474, USA

Name: Eric Zaman
Shots_Fired: Zaman inexplicably crashed his motorcycle into a parked car about 8:30 p.m. Police claimed that they'd been pursuing other motorcyclists nearby, but not Zaman. Eyewitnesses asserted that a police cruiser made contact with Zaman's bike and caused the crash.
Full_Address: Jamaica Avenue & Barbey Street, Brooklyn, NY 11207, USA

Name: Marlene Rivera
Shots_Fired: Rivera and a fellow rookie NYPD officer who'd graduated from the academy rode home together from a nightclub at 4:30, Rivera as passenger. The other rookie crashed with a blood-alcohol level above the legal limit, killing her friend. She pled guilty to manslaughter charges and was sentenced to jail time.
Full_Address: West Sunrise Highway & Wantagh State Parkway, Wantagh, NY 11793, USA

Name: Leroy Martinez
Shots_Fired: Martinez was chased by police after allegedly shooting people at a playground. After Martinez wouldn't drop his gun he was shot by police.

Name: Shiquan M. Krouser
Shots_Fired: Krouser was approached by an officer for disturbing the peace. He then cut the officer with a box cutter, prompting another officer to shoot and kill Krouser.
Full_Address: Main Street & Academy Street, Poughkeepsie, NY 12601, USA

Name: Frank Sidney Smody
Shots_Fired: Police were called to respond to a trespasser on Smody's property. When the officer arrived he 'came under fire'. The officer returned fire, killing Smody.
Full_Address: 3700 State Highway BB, Neelyville, MO 63954, USA

Name: Henry Curtis
Shots_Fired: Curtis lunged at a deputy with a knife and was subsequently shot and killed.

Name: Noel Enrique Aguilar
Shots_Fired: Aguilar got into a fire fight with a deputy. The deputy got shot and recovered, Aguilar died.
Full_Address: 303 East 9th Street, Long Beach, CA 90813, USA

Name: Isaac Sims
Shots_Fired: Sims, suffering from ptsd, fired shots at his father and neighbor. Police were called, and ultimately shot and killed Sims.
Full_Address: 2300 Lawndale Avenue, Kansas City, MO 64127, USA

Name: Terry Heath
Shots_Fired: Heath lunged at officers with a knife and was shot and killed.

Name: Mark Anthony Blocker
Shots_Fired: Blocker had a pellet gun that looked like a real gun. Officers felt threatened and shot and killed Blocker.

Name: Quintico Goolsby
Shots_Fired: Goolsby shot and killed two of his friends then shot an officer who then returned fire, killing Goolsby.
